security_audit.summary: Pure markdown documentation skill containing only architectural guidance. The SKILL.md file contains ASCII diagrams using backticks, tables, checklists, and templates for architecture decisions. No executable code, no network operations, no filesystem access beyond reading its own files. All 52 static findings are false positives: backticks are markdown code block delimiters, not shell execution; 'cryptographic algorithm' flags triggered by architecture terminology misidentification; URL is standard metadata.

content.value_statement: Choosing the right architecture pattern is critical for project success but requires evaluating many factors. This skill provides a systematic framework for selecting architecture patterns based on project size, team capabilities, and business requirements.
actual_capabilities: Recommends architecture patterns based on project size and team experience
Provides visual diagrams for Layered, Clean, Hexagonal, Event-Driven, and CQRS patterns
Offers directory structure templates for feature-based and layer-based organizations
Includes a trade-off analysis template for documenting architectural decisions
Presents a validation checklist to verify architecture selections
limitations: Does not generate code implementations for selected architectures
Does not estimate project timelines or resource requirements
Does not integrate with CI/CD pipelines or deployment systems

use_cases.title: Evaluate pattern trade-offs
use_cases.description: Compare architecture patterns using the trade-off analysis template to document decisions

use_cases.title: Structure new projects
use_cases.description: Select appropriate directory structures based on project size and feature organization

use_cases.title: Validate architectural choices
use_cases.description: Use validation checklists to ensure architecture matches team capabilities

prompt_templates.title: Quick pattern selection
prompt_templates.scenario: Choosing architecture for a new project
prompt_templates.prompt: What architecture pattern should I use for a [size] project with [team_size] developers working on [project_type]?

prompt_templates.title: Compare approaches
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare monolith and microservices architecture for a [scale] application. Consider team size of [n] and requirements for [requirements].

prompt_templates.title: Create directory structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a feature-based directory structure for a [tech_stack] application with [n] main features including users, orders, and payments.

prompt_templates.title: Document architecture decision
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me document the decision to use [pattern] over [alternative] for a [project_description]. Include trade-offs for complexity, scalability, and team familiarity.

output_examples.input: What architecture should I use for a small e-commerce app with 2 developers?
output: Why: Simple CRUD app, small team, quick prototypes

output_examples.input: Help me choose between Clean Architecture and Hexagonal Architecture for a long-term enterprise project
output: Both patterns are suitable for complex, long-lived projects with testability requirements.
Recommendation: Choose Clean Architecture if your domain logic is complex. Choose Hexagonal if you need to support multiple external integrations.

best_practices: Start with the simplest architecture that meets current requirements and evolve as complexity grows
Match architecture complexity to team experience and skills to ensure maintainability
Document architectural decisions including trade-offs and rationale for future reference
anti_patterns: Over-engineering early by choosing microservices when a monolith would suffice
Ignoring team capabilities when selecting architecture patterns
Failing to validate architecture selections against project requirements

faq.question: Which tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code for architectural guidance.

faq.question: What project sizes are covered?
faq.answer: Small (<10K LOC) uses MVC, medium (10K-100K) uses Clean Architecture, large (>100K) uses Modular Monolith or Microservices.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with existing projects?
faq.answer: This is a guidance-only skill. It provides patterns and templates but does not modify project files.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill contains no executable code. It only provides architectural guidance through prompts.

faq.question: Why was my architecture recommendation rejected?
faq.answer: Validation checks may fail if the pattern does not match project size, team skills, or scalability requirements.

faq.question: How does this compare to hiring an architect?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured guidance but cannot replace domain expertise or complex stakeholder negotiations.
